result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer L Loehr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

TO BE DETERMINED - Restitution hearing to be scheduled.  On 10/14/2016 - Court ordered restitution in the amount of $39.00, and is to be JOINT & SEVERAL with any other defendants.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Inmate Request to the Court

9:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Christenson - defense will stip to $39.00 to Berlin Police Department, and makes further statement.  Atty Zamzow concurs.  Court orders $39.00 restitution - joint and several with any other co-defendants.

Court adjourned at 9:35 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Jennifer L Loehr - per defendant
Current: 557 Grove St, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 08-23-2016)
Prior: N5323 State Rd 26, Brandon, WI 53919 United States
Restitution hearing on October 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

9:48 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - have reached a resolution and have prepared a plea questionnaire.  Atty Zamzow recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 as PTAC with court costs and a request for a restitution hearing.  ADA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA Sample.

Court sets for Restitution Hearing within the next 60 days - . 

Court adjourned at 9:54 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:22 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court adjourned at 11:29 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Court sets for plea & sentencing on June 21, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.
